intro: Arabis halleri var. pilifera, commonly known as the hairy rockcress, is a flowering plant native to central and southern Europe. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. This variety is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss in dry environments. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters, typically blooming in early spring. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions.
